summary: EAV is a small enveloped virus with a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome of 12.7 kb. it belongs to the family Arteriviridae, which also includes porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (PRRSV), simian hemorrhagic fever virus (SHFV) and lactate dehydrogenase-elevating virus (LDV) of mice. type I interferon (IFN-/) is a key component of the host innate immune response to viral infection. recognition of pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs) in double-stranded RNA by intracellular receptors. the IFN- promoter contains positive regulatory domains (PRDs), including the binding sites for different transcription factors. NF-B is also a critical regulator of host innate and adaptive immunity. viruses have evolved strategies to counteract key elements of the IFN response. viruses can either activate or inhibit the NF-B pathway in order to replicate in host cells. virulent Bucyrus strain of EAV (EAV VBS, horse passage 15 pleural fluid; ATCC VR-796, Manassas, VA) was propagated in embryonated chicken eggs. sendai virus, the Cantell strain (SeV; ATCC VR-907, Manassas, VA), was propagated in embryonated chicken eggs. the coding regions of each of the twelve nsps were PCR-amplified from the EAV rVBS full-length infectious cDNA clone. the nsp5, nsp6, nsp10, and nsp12 were expressed as C-terminal FLAG-tagged fusion proteins. the specificity of each recombinant protein was confirmed by immunofluorescence and Western blot analysis. the pRL-SV40 plasmid expresses a Renilla luciferase under the control of a simian virus promoter. the pcDNA3-TRIF and pCMV2-IKK2-WT were purchased from Addgene (Cambridge, MA) polyclonal rabbit antisera recognizing EAV nsp1 (MAb 12A4) and N protein (MAb 3E2) have been described previously. RNA from each culture was treated with DNase to remove any contaminating genomic DNA (gDNA) the reverse transcription reaction was performed with 1 g of total RNA using RT random primers and a MultiScribe reverse transcriptase. gene mRNA was equal to 2Ct where Ct = [(Avg. gene of interest Ct Avg. -GUS Ct)calibrator] the calibrator was calculated from the mean Ct of mock-infected samples for each individual gene. plasmid pCAGGS-NS1 expressing swine influenza virus NS1 was used as positive control. at 20 h after transfection, cells were infected with seV at 5000 HA unit/0.5 mL/well. luciferase activity is defined as the ratio of firefly luciferase reporter activity to Renilla luciferase activity. a transfection mix containing DNA and Lipofectamine 2000 in OPTI-MEM I was incubated at room temperature for 20 min and added to each well. cells were incubated with primary antibody in PBS containing 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA) for 30 min. nuclear staining was performed with DAPI (4′,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole; Sigma, St. Louis, MO) for 3 min at RT. bovine calf serum (HyClone Laboratories, Inc., Logan, UT) and 100 U/g per mL penicillin-streptomycin (Gibco, Carlsbad, CA) virulent Bucyrus strain of EAV (EAV VBS, horse passage 15 pleural fluid; ATCC VR-796, Manassas, VA) was passaged once in EECs to obtain high-titered working stocks for the present study the specificity of each recombinant protein was confirmed by immunofluorescence and Western blot analysis. reporter plasmids expressing the firefly luciferase under control of either the IFN- promoter (p125-Luc) or an artificial promoter containing three IRF-3 binding sites (p55-CIB-Luc) were kindly provided by Yoneyama et al. antisera against nsp9 and nsp11 raised by immunizing rabbits with purified full-length recombinant proteins expressed in coli. anti-FLAG MAb (F3165) purchased from Sigma (St. Louis, MO) was used to detect FLAG-tagged EAV fusion proteins in immunofluorescence assay. FN- primers and probe set were used for PCR amplification with an Applied Biosystems 7500 Fast Real-Time PCR System. cDNA corresponding to the -glucuronidase (-GUS) gene was amplified and used as an endogenous control. all PCR efficiency values were determined using LinReg [50]. MDBK cells were grown in 96-well plates to 70% confluency. cells were infected with VSV-GFP at an m.o.i. of 0.1 and incubated for 18 h. expression of green fluorescence protein was examined under an inverted fluorescence microscope. plasmid pCAGGS-NS1 expressing swine influenza virus NS1 was used as positive control. at 20 h, cells were infected with SeV at 5000 HA unit/0.5 mL/well for 12–16 h. cells were stimulated with 1 g/mL of polyinosinic:polycytidylic. for NF-B p65 staining, cells were treated with 20 ng/mL of TNF-. after incubation, cells were washed with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) seV-alone-infected cells were used as positive control for type I IFN induction. mock-infected cells were used as negative control. IFN- mRNA expression was barely detected in cells infected with EAV alone. replication was not inhibited in MDBK cells that were preincubated with cell culture supernatant from EECs infected with EAV alone. the data suggest that EAV has an ability to suppress the induction of type I IFN in infected cells. infection GFP expression was assessed by fluorescence microscopy. each dilution was tested in duplicate. each dilution was tested in duplicate. reporter signal was observed in cells transfected with empty pCAGGS plasmid. nsp1, nsp2, and nsp11 showed strong inhibition of IFN- promoter-driven luciferase expression. results suggest several EAV nsps are capable of suppressing IFN- promoter activation. firefly luciferase reporter activity to Renilla luciferase activity. each data point represents a mean value standard error of the mean (SEM) from three experiments. nsp1 of EAV showed the strongest inhibitory effect on the IFN- promoter activation. HEK293T cells were cotransfected with reporter plasmid of (a) p55-CIB-Luc and (b) NF-B-Luc and a plasmid that constitutively expresses Renilla luciferase. cells were harvested and analyzed for firefly and Renilla luciferase. cells cultured in 24-well plates were cotransfected with plasmid pEFneo-RIG-I, pEFneo-RIG-I, pEFneo-MDA-5, pEGFP- and p55-CIB-Luc reporter plasmid. nsp1 had the ability to suppress TBK1- and IKK-mediated IFN- induction. nsp1 inhibits the signaling process downstream I cells were harvested and measured for firefly and Renilla luciferase activities. luciferase reporter activity is defined as a ratio of firefly luciferase reporter activity to Renilla luciferase activity. effect of EAV nsp1 on NF-B signaling pathway was analyzed in detail. EAV nsp1 inhibits the NF-B signaling pathway. cell cultured in 24-well plates were cotransfected with pNF-B-Luc, pRL-SV40, and pCAGGS expressing nsp1 or pCAGGS empty vector. effect of EAV nsp1 expression on nuclear translocation of IRF-3 and NF-B. expression of IRF-3 was stained with anti-IRF-3 antibody. expression of EAV nsp1 did not block the nuclear translocation of IRF-3. cells were transfected with FLAG-tagged EAV nsp1 for 12 h. cells were stimulated with poly(I:C) (1 g/mL) for 8 h. cells were fixed and stained with rabbit anti-IRF-3 Ab. seV-alone-infected cells were used as positive control for type I IFN induction. mock-infected cells were used as negative control for type I IFN induction. IFN- mRNA expression was barely detected in cells infected with EAV. EECs were mock-infected or infected with EAV VBS at an m.o.i. of 1 for 24 h. RT-PCR was performed for the detection of equine IFN- mRNA expression from three independent experiments. each dilution was tested in duplicate. the expression of sw-ns1 inhibited IFN- promoter-driven luciferase expression. nsp1, nsp2, and nsp11 showed strong inhibition of IFN- promoter-driven luciferase expression. results suggest several EAV nsps are capable of suppressing IFN- promoter activation. luciferase reporter activity to Renilla luciferase activity. each data point represents a mean value standard error of the mean (SEM) from three experiments. nsp1 of EAV showed the strongest inhibitory effect on the IFN- promoter activation. HEK293T cells were cotransfected with reporter plasmid of (a) p55-CIB-Luc and (b) NF-B-Luc and a plasmid that constitutively expresses Renilla luciferase. cells were harvested and analyzed for firefly and Renilla luciferase. cells cultured in 24-well plates were cotransfected with plasmid pEFneo-RIG-I, pEFneo-RIG-I, pEFneo-MDA-5, pEGFP-N1-MAVS. nsp1 had the ability to suppress TBK1- and IKK-mediated IFN- induction. nsp1 inhibits the signaling process downstream IRF-3 activation. luciferase reporter activity is defined as a ratio of firefly luciferase reporter activity to Renilla luciferase activity. pcDNA3-TRIF, pEFneo-IKK, or pCAGGS-IRF-3 along with a pCAGGS empty vector, pRL-SV40. overexpression of p65, a subunit of the NF-B complex, had no effect on the activation of the transcription of NF-B-driven reporter gene. however, EAV nsp1 significantly reduced the expression level of luciferase reporter signal. effect of EAV nsp1 expression on nuclear translocation of IRF-3 and NF-B. expression of IRF-3 was stained with anti-IRF-3 antibody. expression of EAV nsp1 did not block the nuclear translocation of IRF-3. HeLa cells were transfected with FLAG-tagged EAV nsp1 for 12 h. cells were stimulated with poly(I:C) (1 g/mL) for 8 h. cells were fixed and stained with rabbit anti-IRF-3 and mouse anti-FLAG Ab. nsp1, nsp2, and nsp11 encode viral proteins capable of inhibiting interferon activity. this suggests important roles for these proteins in pathogenesis and disease outcome. nsp1, nsp2, and nsp11 could inhibit the host immune response. cytokines are inhibited during in vivo EAV infection. expression of nsp1 had the strongest inhibitory effect on IFN- promoter activation. previous studies on PRRSV also demonstrated that the EAV nsp1 homologous, PRRSV nsp1/ has the strongest ability to inhibit type I IFN synthesis. nsp1 does not contain the traditional nuclear localization signal. further studies are required to map the exact point(s) on the IFN induction pathway at which nsp1 acts.
